turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Laugh it up.  You'll cry later.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: You'll cry like a great big, blubbering baby.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: What the... ?!  What was that for?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Follow me.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: How come everyone thinks hitting me's the best way to get my attention?

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: Where we going?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: We have to find Kittle.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: Okay.  But, what changed our mind?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Just keep an eye out till I get this rig up and running.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: Let's go!  Fuck everything!  God damn sons of bitching mother humpers... I'm gonna rip'em all brand new assholes... !

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Hey... HEY!    Cool down, Jumbo!

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: I can't believe we're stealing.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: We're not stealing.  We're borrowing.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: No, we're stealing.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: This is the police lock-up.  We're police.  How can we steal from ourselves?

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: Then, why'd we tie him up?

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: Who said it wa's me, hub?  Anyway... he fell off a ladder.  It wasn't really my fault.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Well, I got something..  Pop-Sweet's accounting ledger for the Disco-Strip.  All the money transactions.  Look...  Someone's putting their initials beside the weekly totals.  Like they're acknowledging a deposit.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You live like a pig.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: Can't you say something nice once?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Okay.  It doesn't smell as bad in here as I remember it smelling.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Bad news is, word's spreading like wildfire that we don't have badges, and nobody wants to end up getting splattered like Butch Cassidy either.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: If we don't catch a break soon, we're gonna be left standing with our dicks in our hands.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Speak for yourself.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Whoa, whoa... it's gonna be alright.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: ... where... where's a jerk like me ever gonna find another girl to love him... huh?...

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Don't talk like that.  There's plenty of women around for jerks like you.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: You're lying...

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You plan on shooting that gun or just hugging it?

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: I'm waiting till the time's right.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: What about Jack Daniels?  Wasn't he a decorated general in the Civil War?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: General Jim Beam, then.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Nope.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: Oh.  Well.   I think it's pretty common knowledge that in the Battle of Little Big Horn, Custer was drunk off his ass.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Billy, I love you I really do... but I've got to tell you, every day, in every way, you give new meaning to the word "stupidity."

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: What can I say to that... except, I love you too, you mean-spirited bitch.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: You could start over again with cash like that.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Go wherever you want.  Live how you want.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: Feels like there's a bullet still in my chest.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: There probably is.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: Bummer.

turns.speaker: BILLY-BOY
turns.text: He tried to kill us.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: We've got the tape to prove it.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Hey now, look!  Let's all get on the same page here.  This shipment is do or die for Zimmermann's syndicate; all or nothing.  If we stop the drugs, we don't even have to catch him red-handed.  He's ruined cause his pushers go broke with nothing to sell.  On the other hand, if we fuck this up, it means more zombies crawling the gutters than ever and a morgue that doesn't have a single empty drawer.  More old ladies getting mugged and molested by junk-hungry needle-freaks, and all the while Zimmermann's sitting back and laughing his head off.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN ALBERT
turns.text: There'll be other chances.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Not like this.  Are you even listening?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: I'm gonna put a great big, ear-to-fucking-ear smile on your face.  How 'bout that?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN ALBERT
turns.text: Where have you been?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: I'm here.  That's all that counts. Watch... you'll enjoy this... it's like magic...

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Our resignations.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN ALBERT
turns.text: You going rogue on me?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Maybe.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN ALBERT
turns.text: What happened, Kittle?  We used to be friends.  You used to know how the game was played.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: You mean taking bribes, and skimming busts and letting hoods walk? You mean not being able to sleep at night after shaking down some honest Joe?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN ALBERT
turns.text: There was a time when you did things the right way, till you hooked up with that fat-assed-boozehound and the soul-sister.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN ALBERT
turns.text: It's noon straight up.  Effective immediately, you three work desk jobs till midnight.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You can't be serious.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN ALBERT
turns.text: Can't I?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: We've been chasing this deal six months, and now you're gonna chuck it out the window?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: He went to pick up lunch.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN ALBERT
turns.text: Well, shake a leg.  Get these files downstairs...  And, quit listening to your fucking voodoo music.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: D.A. RAVICH
turns.text: And, what... what am I forgetting? Oh, yes... the transvestite junkie whose bullet riddled body came blasting through the front doors of the precinct house!

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Well, sir...

turns.speaker: D.A. RAVICH
turns.text: No.  Don't open your mouth!  You <U>honestly</U> think you can explain this to my satisfaction?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: I... I think I can... clarify...

turns.speaker: D.A. RAVICH
turns.text: Don't bother.  This behavior's gone on too long.  You're suspended.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Don't you condescend to tell me how or why to honor Independence Day, and don't tell me I'm overreacting when I'm trying to bust the guy responsible for half the filthy junk coming into this city!

turns.speaker: D.A. RAVICH
turns.text: You're about an inch away from insubordination!

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Well... seeing how you just suspended me, what's to stop me from calling you a crazy bastard, you old fart?

turns.speaker: D.A. RAVICH
turns.text: Till the last firework fizzles out tonight, detective, you sit a desk. And, after that, I'll decide if you keep your shield.

turns.speaker: ZIMMERMANN
turns.text: What can we do for you, officers? What new, mindless harassments have you planned this morning?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Just wanted to make you aware... before today's over, we'll be standing on top of your mountain of horse and pissing down on you.

turns.speaker: ZIMMERMANN
turns.text: Thank you for sharing that charming image.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Couldn't have said it better myself.

turns.speaker: ZIMMERMANN
turns.text: You bust some small-time pimps, whores and dime-bag junkies, like the world's a better place because you're in it.  And for what, Kittle... two hundred and fifty dollars a week? Tell me, how does anyone get so self-rightious when they can barely afford to pay their rent?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Just 'cause you belong to some fancy-pants club, doesn't make you any less a murderer.

turns.speaker: ZIMMERMANN
turns.text: Murderer?  Really?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Thanks, but we don't recognize "brunch" as an actual meal.

turns.speaker: ZIMMERMANN
turns.text: I insist.  What will it be?  Boston Tea Party Clam Chowder, or maybe the Chicken Red, White and Cordon Bleu? No...  There's a special on the menu, today only...  ... <U>roasted</U> <U>pig</U>.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Your poison's not gonna make it into the veins of any kids this time.

turns.speaker: ZIMMERMANN
turns.text: Wave that flag, hero.  Keep dreaming those dreams.

turns.speaker: ZIMMERMANN
turns.text: You fuckers... damn you!  Why?!  Why me!?  Why the obsession with me?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: It's our job.

turns.speaker: ZIMMERMANN
turns.text: You think you accomplished something... like you're heroes? Fuck you!   This is meaningless! You'll never win!  You know, as soon as I'm gone... someone's going to take my place.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Pardon me... my mistake.  Taking your thoughts in hand, huh... ?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Whoops... don't mind me.  Go ahead and finish up.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Pure horse.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: You are such a disappointment, Benny.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Arriving tonight

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Going into Zimmermann's pipeline.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Why do you bother with that mumbo-jumbo crap?  Some fruitcake's writing it between bong hits, making it up as he goes, and you're actually taking the time to read it.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Yeah, non-believer?  Here's yours...  "Scorpio, October 24 to November 22: Jupiter is in conflict with Saturn, so proceed with caution..."

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Look out!  Jupiter and Saturn'll get you every fucking time.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: "Today you have a rare opportunity to make a big difference in your chosen field.  By your able leadership and with great conviction and strength of character, you will come up a winner."

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Let me see that...  Not bad.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Yeah... great.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: You know... you could say thank you.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You're the one with the star-spangled hard-on, not me.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: What are you, communist?  At least numb-nuts here has the courtesy to pretend he likes them.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: I just think you should show some respect.  I mean, call me old fashioned, but 200 years ago when Ben Franklin and those guys signed the Constitution and Declaration of Independence, they did that so we could all share in the freedom...

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: First of all, the Constitution wasn't writtem till 1787...

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: You know what I mean.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Second of all, the Declaration of Independence was all for liberty and equality, but it didn't do anything about slavery, did it?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Yeah, well... nobody's perfect.  They couldn't go doing everything at once.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: All I'm saying is, your little Bicentennial mementos would be more accurate if there were no holes in the pepper shaker so the pepper couldn't get out.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Alright?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: We got him.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Slow down.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: "Go, go, go!"  "Slow down."  Make up your mind.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Don't crowd him.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Hold your horses, sweetpea.  We need Butch Cassidy alive, remember?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Shit.  You're right.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: If they crash, maybe he'll run.  You can shoot him in the leg or something.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Let's hope.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: I'm gonna get beside him.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: No you're not.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: I'm gonna get beside.  Nena, you're gonna shoot out his tires.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: No, we are <U>not</U> going to do that.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You... SUCK!  You almost got us all killed!

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: You think this is so easy?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Can't be worse than you.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Oh yeah?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: That's right, white bread.  Give it up.  Right now.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Okay, okay... hold on.  Don't go getting your panties in a knot...

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Get closer!  Don't lose him!

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: I kinda already figured that, but keep those helpful hints coming.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: You put your bumper just behind his left tire and then accelerate... make him spin out...

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Is there nothing in this world you enjoy more than the sound of your own voice?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: What... ?  Not you too?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: He's right.  We hit the bricks, we walk back triple-fucked.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: I can't believe I'm hearing this,

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: I worked my ass off for my badge, Kittle,  It's the only thing that makes me different from every other slob out there.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: That's not true.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: I know it is, even if you don't.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Yeah, my arms healed up real good, and that's how I wanna keep 'em. That's what I'm trying to tell you.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Guys... all we've got is each other. Don't we know that by now?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You need a doctor.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Nothing's broke.  Keep sewing.  And quit pacing, you big ox.  You're making me skittish.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Any preferences?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Whatever goes bang.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Let's get this thing done.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: All for one...

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Alright, flesh-peddler, let's see empty hands!

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Out here.  On your knees.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You get him?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Dead.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Chalk up another victory for Billy-Boy's one man war on crime.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: If it is, that's pretty high up on the totem pole.  What do you think?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Gimmie a minute.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Alright... how about you two hit the strip and start knocking some heads together?  Find out who "A.D." is.  I got a quick errand to run.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Sounds good.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Been waiting long?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Just got here.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: How'd we do?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: A.D. is a C.P.A.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Come again... ?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Archibald Dobbs; Certified Public Accountant.  But, that's all we got.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Maybe it's enough.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Get his attention.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Your wish is my command.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Hey-Ho... !  Maybe we're not alone in this thing after all.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Who is that... ?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: What the hell's his problem?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You mean, besides the warrant out on us for blowing up our commanding officer?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You're... you're not doing what I think you're doing... ?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Seatbelts fastened, please.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You suck at lying, Archie.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: See... now that we know you know, the hard part's done for us.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: It's just a question of how long do we have to slap you silly till you spill the beans.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: We're screwed.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: I'm well aware of that.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: This much powder you don't throw in the trunk with a blanket over it. It's got to be smuggled.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: There's not even enough places to stash it in a car.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: No more counting the big money for someone else.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Beholden to none.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Think Zimmermann's watching?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Who the fuck knows?  We'll find out soon enough.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: You John-Wilkes-Booth-ed him.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Billy!  Billy!

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Why the beach?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: So there's nobody around to get killed in the explosion.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Oh, yeah... the explosion.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Know what I love about dynamite?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Do tell.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: When you bunch it together, it's exponentially more powerful.  Two sticks have the power of four sticks. Four sticks have the power of sixteen, and so on.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Well, that's what I heard, and that's what I choose to believe.

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: The gang's all here!

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Keep 'em busy.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: You see that?

turns.speaker: NENA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: Good.  Thought I was imagining them.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: You always did have style.

turns.speaker: POP-SWEET
turns.text: It's one of a kind.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: So are you, Pop-Sweet.  That's why...

turns.speaker: POP-SWEET
turns.text: This shit was Ming.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: That's the problem with expensive tastes... the more you got, the more you got to lose.

turns.speaker: POP-SWEET
turns.text: Where's your pet gorilla and the female Uncle Tom?

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: They're... around.

turns.speaker: POP-SWEET
turns.text: Yeah?  So, what do you want to ask today that I can't answer?  I'm a busy man.

turns.speaker: KITTLE
turns.text: The way Zimmermann takes such good care of you and this drug-peddling "escort service" of yours, I figure you got the scoop on the pharmaceuticals arriving tonight.

turns.speaker: POP-SWEET
turns.text: Well, let me tell you how it is...

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: Admiral, we're in position. All fighters accounted for.

turns.speaker: ACKBAR
turns.text: Proceed with the countdown. All groups assume attack coordinates.

turns.speaker: ACKBAR
turns.text: All craft, prepare to jump to hyperspace on my mark.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: All right. Stand by.

turns.speaker: ACKBAR
turns.text: We saw it. All craft prepare to retreat.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: You won't get another chance at this, Admiral.

turns.speaker: ACKBAR
turns.text: We have no choice, General Calrissian. Our cruisers can't repel firepower of that magnitude.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: Han will have that shield down. We've got to give him more time.

turns.speaker: ACKBAR
turns.text: At that close range, we won't last long against those Star Destroyers.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: We'll last longer then we will against that Death Star...and we might just take a few of them with us.

turns.speaker: ACKBAR
turns.text: The shield is down! Commence attack on theDeath Star's main reactor.

turns.speaker: LANDO
turns.text: We're on our way. Red Group, Gold Group, all fighters follow me.  Told you they'd do it!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I can't do it, Artoo. I can't go on alone.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Yoda will always be with you.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: You told me Vader betrayed and murdered my father.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You father was seduced by the dark side of the Force. He ceased to be Anakin Skywalker and became Darth Vader. When that happened, the good man who was your father was destroyed. So what I have told you was true... from a certain point of view.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: There's still good in him.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: I also thought he could be turned back to the good side. It couldn't be done. He is more machine now than man. Twisted and evil.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I can't do it, Ben.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: You cannot escape your destiny.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I tried to stop him once. I couldn't do it.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Vader humbled you when first you met him, Luke... but that experience was part of your training. It taught you, among other things, the value of patience. Had you not been so impatient to defeat Vader then, you could have finished your training here with Yoda. You would have been prepared.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But I had to help my friends.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: To be a Jedi, Luke, you must confront and then go beyond the dark side - the side your father couldn't get past. Impatience is the easiest door - for you, like your father. Only, your father was seduced by what he found on the other side of the door, and you have held firm. You're no longer so reckless now, Luke. You are strong and patient. And now, you must face Darth Vader again!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I can't kill my own father.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Then the Emperor has already won. You were our only hope.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Yoda spoke of another.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: The other he spoke of is your twin sister.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But I have no sister.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Hmm. To protect you both from the Emperor, you were hidden from your father when you were born. The Emperor knew, as I did, if Anakin were to have any offspring, they would be a threat to him. That is the reason why your sister remains safely anonymous.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Leia! Leia's my sister.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: Your insight serves you well. Bury your feelings deep down, Luke. They do you credit. But they could be made to serve the Emperor.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: But you can't let her get involved now, Ben. Vader will destroy her.

turns.speaker: BEN
turns.text: She hasn't been trained in the ways of the Jedi the way you have, Luke... but the Force is strong with her, as it is with all of your family. There is no avoiding the battle. You must face and destroy Vader!

turns.speaker: BOUSHH
turns.text: Shhh. You have hibernation sickness.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I can't see.

turns.speaker: BOUSHH
turns.text: Your eyesight will return in time.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Where am I?

turns.speaker: BOUSHH
turns.text: Jabba's palace.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: The Death Star will be completed on schedule.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: You have done well, Lord Vader. And now I sense you wish to continue your search for young Skywalker.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: Yes, my Master.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Patience, my friend. In time he will seek you out. And when he does, you must bring him before me. He has grown strong. Only together can we turn him to the dark side of the Force.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: As you wish.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Everything is proceeding as I have foreseen.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: What is thy bidding, my Master?

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Send the fleet to the far side of Endor. There it will stay until called for.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: What of the reports of the Rebel fleet massing near Sullust?

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: It is of no concern. Soon the Rebellion will be crushed and young Skywalker will be one of us! Your work here is finished, my friend. Go out to the command ship and await my orders.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: Yes, my Master.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: I told you to remain on the command ship.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: A small Rebel force has penetrated the shield and landed on Endor.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: I have felt him, my Master.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Strange, that I have not. I wonder if your feelings on this matter are clear, Lord Vader.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: They are clear, my Master.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Then you must go to the Sanctuary Moon and wait for them.

turns.speaker: EMPEROR
turns.text: Oh, no, my young Jedi. You will find that it is you who are mistaken...about a great many things.

turns.speaker: VADER
turns.text: His lightsaber.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Han!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Luke!

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Are you all right?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Fine. Together again, huh?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Wouldn't miss it.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: How are we doing?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: The same as always.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: That bad, huh? Where's Leia?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I think my eyes are getting better. Instead of a big dark blur, I see a big light blur.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: There's nothing to see. I used to live here, you know.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You're gonna die here, you know. Convenient.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Just stick close to Chewie and Lando. I've taken care of everything.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Oh... great!

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Why don't you leave that crate and come with us?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I have a promise I have to keep first... to an old friend.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Luke.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Hi, Han... Chewie.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: You got her warmed?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Yeah, she's comin' up.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Right. Chewie, let's see what this piece of junk can do. Ready, everybody?

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: All set.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Vader's on that ship.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Now don't get jittery, Luke. There are a lot of command ships. Keep your distance though, Chewie, but don't look like you're trying to keep your distance.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I don't know.  Fly casual.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: I'm endangering the mission. I shouldn't have come.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: It's your imagination, kid. Come on. Let's keep a little optimism here.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Chewie and I will take care of this. You stay here.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Quietly, there might be more of them out there.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: I thought she was with you.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: We got separated.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Take the squad ahead.  We'll meet at the shield generator at 0300.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Come on, Artoo.  We'll need your scanners.

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Nice work. Great, Chewie! Great! Always thinking with your stomach.

turns.speaker: LUKE
turns.text: Will you take it easy? Let's just figure out a way to get out of this thing.  Han, can you reach my lightsaber?

turns.speaker: HAN
turns.text: Yeah, sure.
